com.billsbackyardbees.opal.db

Interface OpalDataType

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PasswordAccount, SecretNote

    public interface OpalDataType
    Defines an Object type that is perfectly compatible with the Opal database tables.
    Author:
    Quinn Shultz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAesEncryptionAlgorithm() 
      java.lang.String getCharacterEncoding()
      Gets the character encoding for the encrypted String, by default this is set as UTF-8 when a new Object is constructed.
      java.lang.String getCipherTransformation() 
      java.lang.String getEncryptedData()
      Gets obfuscated data that may be deciphered with the user's private key.
      int getId()
      All classes that implement this interface are Objects that correspond to tuples in the RDBMS.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of this Object, corresponding to a column entry in the database.
      java.lang.String getOpalUser()
      Gets the owner of this Object, corresponding to the primary key of a tuple in the opalUsers table.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        int getId()
        All classes that implement this interface are Objects that correspond to tuples in the RDBMS. The id is the primary key of all tables. It has option auto increment so there will not be a java method to set the id.
        Returns:
        id and primary key of tuple

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of this Object, corresponding to a column entry in the database.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of this Object

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this Object, corresponding to a column entry in the database.
        Returns:
        Name of this Object

      • setEncryptedData

        void setEncryptedData(java.lang.String data,
                      java.lang.String masterPassword)
        Sets obfuscated data to be stored in this Object and synced to the database.
        Parameters:
        data - Plain-text data to be encrypted with the user's public key and stored

      • getEncryptedData

        java.lang.String getEncryptedData()
        Gets obfuscated data that may be deciphered with the user's private key.
        Returns:
        Encrypted data

      • setOpalUser

        void setOpalUser(java.lang.String opalUser)
        Sets the owner of this Object, corresponding to the primary key of a tuple in the opalUsers table.
        Parameters:
        opalUser - Integer id and primary key of account tuple in opalUsers

      • getOpalUser

        java.lang.String getOpalUser()
        Gets the owner of this Object, corresponding to the primary key of a tuple in the opalUsers table.
        Returns:
        Integer id and primary key of account tuple in opalUsers

        void setCharacterEncoding(java.lang.String characterEncoding)

        boolean isModifiedFromDB()
        Returns:
